page.title: 06ROMAN ROAD NEAR ANDOVER
page.content: Arrowing its way across our area from east to west runs the course of an{ancient Roman roadway}known as the {Port Way.}Little exists of it today although a map or aerial view reveals it clearly and several modern roads and tracks follow its course. In its day it was apparently one of the{major east-west routes}used by the occupying Roman armies of the first few centuries A.D., running from Silchester in the east through to Old Sarum, and on towards the south-west. Although no one seems very sure, the general opinion appears to be that the road lost much of its importance with the departure of the Romans, and long sections of it were abandoned in early Saxon times.
